subject: Thanks - Can't run Junit on Windows - How can I help ?
messageBody:
Thanks for explanation.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
>
> roberto_lucente wrote:
>
> > I am a newbie. I also ran into the fact that JUNIT doesn't use the
> > pathSeparator of Java. The details can be found at
> > http://rlucente.bloki.com/forum/messages-index.jsp?
> > tid=124461&fid=54832#forum-message1133407541851rlucente.
> >
> > Since I am new, the best that I can do is offer to test and write
> > documentation.
>
> This is completely wrong. "/" /is/ the path separator of Java for
> packages and the class name. This "/" has /nothing/ to do with
the "/"
> or "\" path separator in files.
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
> Your guide to software craftsmanship
> JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
> 2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
>
